Package edu.ntnu.idatt2001.runarin.backend.filehandling

Class FileHandler

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt2001.runarin.backend.filehandling.FileHandler
public class FileHandler extends Object
Class handles reading and writing of files regarding data in the Army class.
Since:
2022-05-09
Version:
3.0
Author:
Runar Indahl

  • Constructor Details

    • FileHandler

      public FileHandler()

  • Method Details

    • writeArmyToFile

      public static void writeArmyToFile(Army army, String filePath) throws IOException
      Creates a new csv-file, or writes to existing, and writes information about the army and its units to a wanted location. The file name is the same as the army's name.
      Parameters:
      filePath - path to where the generated file is to be stored. The file-name itself is generated based on the army name.
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown from FileWriter-object.

    • readArmyNameFromFile

      public static String readArmyNameFromFile(String file) throws IOException, IllegalArgumentException
      Returns only the army name from a file.
      Parameters:
      file - path and file name of the file to be read.
      Returns:
      army name.
      Throws:
      IOException - from BufferedReader.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file is not in the right format or the file is blank.

    • readUnitsFromFile

      public static ArrayList<Unit> readUnitsFromFile(Army army, String file) throws IOException, IllegalArgumentException
      Reads an army-file and returns an ArrayList with the army's units.
      Parameters:
      file - path and file name of the file to be read.
      Throws:
      CorruptedFileException - throws exception if the file data is corrupted.
      IOException - from BufferedReader.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file is not in the right format, the army is missing or the file is blank.

    • writeStringBuilderToFile

      public static void writeStringBuilderToFile(StringBuilder battleLog, String fileName) throws IOException
      Writes string from StringBuilder to battle log-file.
      Parameters:
      battleLog - the battle log in StringBuilder format to be written to a text-file.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the StringBuilder battle log is empty.
      IOException - thrown from FileWriter-object.

    • readStringBuilderFromFile

      public static StringBuilder readStringBuilderFromFile() throws IOException
      Returns a StringBuilder containing text information from a file.
      Returns:
      StringBuilder containing text information from a file.
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by BufferedReader.
